ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Voyager 1 Plasma Spectrometer (PLS) VIPER-Fit Plasma Ion Composition near Jupiter, 96 s Data
ResourceHeader.Description: These Data are from a Re-Analysis of the Voyager Plasma Spectrometer, PLS, Data at Jupiter by the PLS Group at the Laboratory for Atmospheric and Space Physics, LASP, at the University of Colorado. Density, Temperature, and Flow Velocity Fits for total and individual Ions were done using the Voyager Ion PLS Experiment Response, VIPER, Code and Error Analysis as described at http://lasp.colorado.edu/home.mop/missions/voyager/viper/. Fits are determined from processing of the Ion Currents from the A, B, C, and D Cups of the Instrument. As per the Fit Case Variable, one of five different Constraints were used in the VIPER Fits for each 96 s Time Interval: (1) Free Variation of all Parameters (mainly for the cold Ion Torus), (2) Constraint of the Ion Abundances for the five major Species (O+, O++, S+, S++, S+++) to standard Composition as determined from Delamere et al., (2005), (3) fixed Ion Composition and Flow Speed, (4) Cold Blobs in the Plasmasheet where resolved Peaks can be Fit with allowance for some Variance in Composition, (5) Interpolation between Composition of Cold Torus and standard Abundances at 6 RJ from Delamere et al., (2005). Reference: Delamere, P.A., Bagenal, F., and Steffl, A. (2005), Radial Variations in the Io Plasma Torus During the Cassini Era, J. of Geophys. Res., Space Phys., 110(A12), A12223, doi:10.1029/2005JA011251.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: J.D. Richardson, F. Bagenal, Please acknowledge the Voyager 1 and Voyager 2 PLS PI, J.D. Richardson, MIT, and the Data Set Producer, F. Bagenal of the University of Colorado. For Public Distribution but Users are advised to contact F. Bagenal on Questions about how the Data were produced.

Parameter.Name: Time since 0 A.D.
Parameter.Description: Interval centered Time Tag rounded to the nearest Millisecond

Parameter.Name: Start Date, Year
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Integer Value for Start Date, Integer Year

Parameter.Name: Start Date, Fractional Year
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Decimal Start Date equal to the Interger Year plus the Fraction of the Year for the given Observation

Parameter.Name: Start Date, Day of Year
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Start Date, Integer Day of Year

Parameter.Name: Start Date, Hour of Day
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Start Date, Integer Hour of Day

Parameter.Name: Start Date, Minute of Hour
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Start Date, Integer Minute of Hour

Parameter.Name: Start Date, Seconds of Minute
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Start Date, Integer Seconds of Minute

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Location, Radial Distance, RJ, RHSII
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft Location, Radial Distance in Jupiter Radii, Rj, Right-Handed System III, RHSIII, Coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: Spacecraft Location in the Right-Handed System III Coordinate Frame (RHSIII) in absolute Distances from the Center of Jupiter. The Radius of Jupiter, RJ, equals 71,492 km.

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Location, Co-Latitude, RHSIII
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft Location, Co-Latitude in Right-Handed System III, RHSIII, Coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: RHSIII refers to the Right-Handed System III Coordinate System for Spacecraft Position in the Jovian Magnetosphere.

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Location, East Longitude, RHSIII
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft Location, East Longitude in Right-Handed System III, RHSIII, Coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: RHSIII refers to the Right-Handed System III Coordinate System for Spacecraft Position in the Jovian Magnetosphere.

Parameter.Name: VIPER Fit Case Number
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Fit Case Number 1-5, designates how the Fit Parameters were handled by the VIPER Code
Parameter.Caveats: Methods of how the Parameters being fit were handled by VIPER: 1. Variation of all Parameters (mostly the inner Cold Torus). 2. Constraining the Ion Abundances of the five main Ion Species (O+, O++, S+, S++, S+++) to the standard Composition based on Delamere et al., [2005]. 3. Fixed Ion Composition plus Fixed Flow Speed. 4. cold Blobs in the Plasmasheet where resolved Peaks can be fit allowing some Variations in Composition. 5. Interpolation between the Composition of the Cold Torus and the Standard Composition at 6 Jovian Radii from Delamere et al., [2005].

Parameter.Name: Radial Flow Velocity, RHSII
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Bulk Plasma Flow Velocity, Radial Component in Right-Handed System III, RHSIII, Coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: RHSIII refers to the Right-Handed System III Coordinate System for Spacecraft Position in the Jovian Magnetosphere.

Parameter.Name: Bulk Plasma Flow Velocity, East Longitude, RHSIII
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Bulk Plasma Flow Velocity, East Longitude, Phi, in Right-Handed System III, RHSIII, Coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: RHSIII refers to the Right-Handed System III Coordinate System for Spacecraft Position in the Jovian Magnetosphere.

Parameter.Name: Northward Flow Velocity, RHSIII
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Bulk Plasma Flow Velocity, Northward Component in Right-Handed System III, RHSIII, Coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: RHSIII refers to the Right-Handed System III Coordinate System for Spacecraft Position in the Jovian Magnetosphere. Northward is in northern Direction of the Planetary Spin Axis.
